irobots.comm

Class CommunicationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • irobots.comm.CommunicationManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class CommunicationManager
extends java.lang.Thread
    The CommunicationManager provides functions which can be used to send messages to other robots. It also runs a background thread that receives messages from the other robots and processes the received messages.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Sends a message.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to send without checksum.

      • receiveMessage

        public void receiveMessage()
        Receives a message from another robot and processes the received message. This method blocks until a message is received. This method is used by the message receiving thread to receive and process incoming messages and should not be called directly.

      • checkChecksum

        public boolean checkChecksum(java.lang.String data)
        Checks if the checksum of the given message is valid.
        Parameters:
        data - The message to check.

      • receivePos

        public void receivePos(java.lang.String p)
        Processes a pos message.

      • sendPos

        public void sendPos()
        Sends the current position of the robot.

      • sendSee

        public void sendSee(int remote,
           int rx,
           int ry)
        Sends a see message.
        Parameters:
        remote - The remot robots id
        rx - The detected x-coordinate of the remote robot
        ry - The detected y-cooddinate of the remote robot

      • split

        public static java.lang.String[] split(java.lang.String s,
                       char c,
                       int count)
        Splits a string at a given char.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to split
        c - The char at which should be split.
        count - The number of parts after the split.
        Returns:
        A String array with the length of count. If the split char does not occur often enough the remaining Strings in the array equal to null.
